posts.post_content: I believe you folks are forgetting that [Entreat the Angels](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Entreat the Angels) is also in Standard. There is also much more potential for this card in Modern as well. I'm thinking a W/B build with [Godless Shrine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Godless Shrine) and[Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth) (did any of you see the giant spike in the price of that card?). The plan would be to stall for as long as possible to get Lili to ultimate by turn 7, then, if you're lucky, miracle [Entreat the Angels](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Entreat the Angels) for at least 20. a 5/5 in my books any day.

Posted By: DoragonShinzui (8/19/2012 10:59:41 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
In my opinion (obviously)...  
  
+1: Unless in some unrealistic future [Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth) gets errata'd into having Swamp as a subtype, this is kind of underwhelming  
  
-3: You probably have better things to do than waste loyalty on spot removal or random pumping  
  
-6: Probably the most noteworthy thing. If this is your goal for her, she probably can't be run outside of mono-black (without [Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice)). At least it's an emblem, but I really wish Lili got an ultimate that said something flavorful and that didn't CONTRADICT THE COLOR PIE like, "You get an emblem with 'Whenever a creature you control dies, return that card to the battlefield.'"  
  
I don't dislike Liliana 3.0, but her abilities seem pretty narrow.
posts.html:

Posted By: Odium1995 (8/5/2012 10:55:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@PurpGuy  
  
Someone else is welcome to correct me if I am wrong but I'm pretty sure your brother is right. To give an example, imagine you're running a deck with [Venser, the Sojourner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser, the Sojourner) and he's in play and free to use his abilities, Liliana of Dark Realms comes into play and she uses her +1, then Venser can blink her out. The game rules dictate that the Liliana that returns to play is not the same one that left so she's free to use her +1 again. Same outcome, just a different scenario. The Liliana that your brother plays is regarded as a new instance of her and he's free to use its abilities.
posts.html:
@PurpGuy

Someone else is welcome to correct me if I am wrong but I'm pretty sure your brother is right. To give an example, imagine you're running a deck with Venser, the Sojourner and he's in play and free to use his abilities, Liliana of Dark Realms comes into play and she uses her +1, then Venser can blink her out. The game rules dictate that the Liliana that returns to play is not the same one that left so she's free to use her +1 again. Same outcome, just a different scenario. The Liliana that your brother plays is regarded as a new instance of her and he's free to use its abilities.
